Hi John

I’m working through your very good course on Pluralsight where you build your CodeCamoer SPA. Alot there to learn but I am trying to take out of it what I need as I re write part of our web application using some of the techniques you show.

What I am doing is putting together some functionality for our company’s CRM system. When the company delivers a version of its product to clients there may be issues with it and the tech support guys log thise issues. Each entry is known as a ProductVersionIssue.

So far I have got the Repository/Unit of work pattern returning a collection of ProductVersionIssues which I bind to a Kendo grid. It working fine.

However I have run into an issue. One of the fields of a ProductVersionIssue is TechSupportName and we store a username used company wide for the guy who with deal with the issue. The convention is say for me “Gary James” “gjames”. There is a table of users where each employee has a arow and the key is their username. In that table is the friendly name to display “Gary James”.

Of course so far my repository of ProductVersionIssues is pulling through the username when I really need it to show the display name held in the Users table. I cant seem to visualize the best way to go about achieving this using the repository patern. Maybe code in the UOW?

This of course would be for a no editable field but if I wanted to make this field a dropdown on the UI where the users can change the name of the TechSupport guy by choosing from a list of users and save that back, what I would want to push back down to the ProductVersionIssue record is the new username chosen by the user of the SPA.

Could you be so kind as to give me some ideas on how to achieve this or point me in the right directions of an example?

Many Thanks
